Rule_Conditions_Update_For_PUT
properties.description: This conditions will be used when user trying to update the rule.

1. Create a Task rule (combination of conditions) and Map the Workflow with Input Variables (Post) 
2. Update a Task rule with new condition , add one more workflow (PUT)
3. Create a Workflow having create approval task 
4. Verify whthere rule triggered the workflow or not ? 
5. Disable the Rule at system level and Verify workflow is not triggered 
6. Disable the rule at workflow level and verify disabled rule on wf should not trigger and other should trigger 
7. Create a Rule with Invalid WF 
8. Create a Rule with Empty title 
9. Create a Rule with EMpty Conditions 
10. Create a Rule with Empty title in Properties Level
11. Create a rule with display name more than 64 chars
12. Create Rule with invalid schema id - Should throw valid error message
13. Try to delete a rule with invalid id
properties.display_name: XDR - Approval Task Rule Feature Automation

properties.name: Provide Request Body if needed (Ex: Create targets, wf's)
Error Message
properties.description: Created Object Error Message

properties.name: Select Method (EX: GET, PUT, POST, DELETE)
properties.description: The primary or most commonly-used HTTP methods are POST, GET, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE. These methods correspond to create, read, update, and delete (or CRUD) operations, respectively. There are a number of other methods, too, but they are utilized less frequently.

properties.name: Header User-Agent (optional)
properties.description: The User-Agent request header is a characteristic string that lets servers and network peers identify the application, operating system, vendor, and/or version of the requesting user agent

properties.name: Provide Token to run a workflow
properties.description: Provide a Token to Execute the workflow

properties.name: Header Accept (Optional)
properties.description: The Accept request HTTP header indicates which content types, expressed as MIME types, the client is able to understand. The server uses content negotiation to select one of the proposals and informs the client of the choice with the Content-Type response header.

properties.name: Value (Only For Tenant creation) Provide Tenant id
Headers Cookie (Not Mandatory)
properties.description:
An HTTP cookie (web cookie, browser cookie) is a small piece of data that a server sends to a user's web browser. The browser may store the cookie and send it back to the same server with later requests. Typically, an HTTP cookie is used to tell if two requests come from the same browserkeeping a user logged in, for example. It remembers stateful information for the stateless HTTP protocol.

Cookies are mainly used for three purposes:

Session management
Logins, shopping carts, game scores, or anything else the server should remember

Personalization
User preferences, themes, and other settings

Tracking
Recording and analyzing user behavior

properties.name: Approval-Rule-Condition
properties.description:
This is conditions added when user created rule , add more conditions if needed . below is the syntax 

"conditions":{"left_operand":{"left_operand":"$output.status.state$","operator":"eq","right_operand":"completed"},"right_operand":{"left_operand":"$output.subject_line$","right_operand":"Approval Message","operator":"eq"},"operator":"and"},

properties.name: WF_payload_ImportWF(Simple)
AtomicWF_Payload
WF_Payload_Having_Atomic_Subwf

properties.description:
Create a Workflow having Upper Case with String Input Variables 
Create a Approval Rule with above wf and map input variable values from reference picker
Create WF having Approval Request 
Create WF havng Atomic and SubWF with Input Variables 
Update the Rule with WF having atomic and SubWF (ParentWF) and Map the Input Variables
Run the Approval Request WF 
Verify WF triggered from the Rule or not 
Verify the reffered variables resolved or not 
Delete all Created instance
